Type.description: What type of shake to use. Once means the camera will only shake once when the player comes in contact with the volume. Continuous means it won't stop shaking until the player leaves the volume.

ShakeTime.description: How long to shake the camera.

OneTimeOnly.description: Whether this volume can only cause the screen to shake once, or can cause the screen to shake every time the player comes in contact with it.

ShakeType.description: How the screen will shake. Directional means shake up/down on the Y Axis? Random means shake in random directions.

Magnitude.description: How much the screen will shake.

Frequency.description: How frequently the shaking will occur if Type == Continuous.

ZRot.description: How much the shaking should be rotated along the Z axis.

AttnRatio.description: The amount to make it easier to pay attention to what's going on in the background?

EnableDistAttn.description: Whether to shake differently, making it easier to pay attention to what's going on in the background?

Extra.value: A volume (not sure why this one is called a trigger) which causes the screen to SHAKEEE.
